meta_description.description_text: Our Tunnel / Conveyor Ovens are designed to provide high temperature capabilities with increased functionality in industries including metal finishing, automotive, electronics, printing, aerospace, pharmaceutical, and more. Both Tunnel and Conveyor ovens are available in both gas and electric power and are constructed with cast-iron factory built frames and dense mineral wool to provide maximum insulation and durability. These ovens are designed to be compatible with many types of existing conveyor systems in your facility and can be designed to your custom specifications.

title.title_text: Bench Ovens & Cabinet Ovens | Industrial Process Ovens | Manufacturer

meta_description.description_text: View All ProductsOur Bench and Cabinet Ovens are available in a variety of standard and custom sizes and are generally used for a smaller volume than our walk-in or truck-in ovens. Although these ovens are smaller, they are still manufactured using the same quality materials and are factory tested at maximum capacity to ensure proper design and function. Bench and Cabinet ovens are only available in electric power and are completely independent of natural gas power. Like all our ovens, we guarantee the uniformity of temperature throughout the oven and offer a variety of additional options including pans, racks, stands, and shelf brackets to facilitate the treatment of products inside the oven. Our Electric Bench and Cabinet Ovens can be used for a variety of industrial applications including: Paint Curing for water, solvent, or powder based paints. These ovens can also be used for the curing of other finishes including epoxy and varnishes. Baking of food products or other types of products. Metal Finishing on machinery, tools, or other metal products. Repair of machinery, engines, or industrial equipment. Bench / Cabinet Oven Features 3 Angle Iron Frame (Except Model 222) with 8# Density Mineral Wool Insulation 16g Aluminized Steel Interior and Duct Work 16g Cold Rolled Steel Exterior with Zinc Primer and Gray Enamel Finish Ovens are built Standard to 500F Maximum Standard includes Air Circulation, Forced Exhaust, Purge Timer, and Explosion Relief Standard Controls Include LED PID Temperature Controller, High Limit, & Batch Timer Options include: Drip Pan & Loading Rack, Stands, Shelves, Shelf Brackets, & High Temperatures

title.title_text: Industrial Burn-Off Ovens for Plastic & Fiber Industries | Bake-Off Ovens

meta_description.description_text: Steelman Advanced Burn-off Ovens are used in the Plastics and Fiber Industries across the country. Used to clean molds, dies, screws, bowls, tooling, and safely remove thermoplastics, rubber, and polymers, our ovens can accommodate your needs. Steelman Advanced Burn-off Ovens can be equipped with Chart Recorders, Programmable Controllers, PLC or Computer Communication interfaces in order to measure and control precise temperature and time requirements determined by your specific product needs. Our burn-off ovens are equipped with patented top down heating system allowing for uniform temperature within the oven, lower particulate emissions, and control of the hottest part of the oven. Our burn-off ovens are also fitted with a patented system called the Automatic Process System which eliminates operator error using an Automatic Cycle Time System and a Three-Level Safety System.

title.title_text: Tunnel Ovens - Tunnel / Conveyor Ovens - Steelman Industries, Inc.

meta_description.description_text: Our Tunnel Ovens are available in gas and electric and can provide high temperatures for applications in many industries. Our tunnel ovens are available in a variety of standard and custom sizes and can also be customized with additional features which can allow our tunnel ovens to be compatible with the current equipment in your facility. Our tunnel ovens are factory built with cast-iron frames for maximum strength and insulated with high density mineral wool to reduce temperature bleeding. We install UL listed Control Panels and LED PID temperature controls for the highest level of operator control. Our Tunnel Ovens can be used for a variety of industrial applications including: Paint Curing for water, solvent, or powder based paints. These ovens can also be used for the curing of other finishes including epoxy and varnishes. Preheating of molds, dies or other tools. Metal Finishing on machinery, tools, or other metal products. Repair of machinery, engines, or industrial equipment. Our ovens can be used for an unlimited number of applications which require operating temperatures up to 850 F.

title.title_text: Bench Ovens & Cabinet Ovens | Industrial Process Ovens | Manufacturer

meta_description.description_text: View All ProductsOur Bench and Cabinet Ovens are available in a variety of standard and custom sizes and are generally used for a smaller volume than our walk-in or truck-in ovens. Although these ovens are smaller, they are still manufactured using the same quality materials and are factory tested at maximum capacity to ensure proper design and function. Bench and Cabinet ovens are only available in electric power and are completely independent of natural gas power. Like all our ovens, we guarantee the uniformity of temperature throughout the oven and offer a variety of additional options including pans, racks, stands, and shelf brackets to facilitate the treatment of products inside the oven. Our Electric Bench and Cabinet Ovens can be used for a variety of industrial applications including: Paint Curing for water, solvent, or powder based paints. These ovens can also be used for the curing of other finishes including epoxy and varnishes. Baking of food products or other types of products. Metal Finishing on machinery, tools, or other metal products. Repair of machinery, engines, or industrial equipment. Bench / Cabinet Oven Features 3 Angle Iron Frame (Except Model 222) with 8# Density Mineral Wool Insulation 16g Aluminized Steel Interior and Duct Work 16g Cold Rolled Steel Exterior with Zinc Primer and Gray Enamel Finish Ovens are built Standard to 500F Maximum Standard includes Air Circulation, Forced Exhaust, Purge Timer, and Explosion Relief Standard Controls Include LED PID Temperature Controller, High Limit, & Batch Timer Options include: Drip Pan & Loading Rack, Stands, Shelves, Shelf Brackets, & High Temperatures

title.title_text: Industrial Burn-Off Ovens for Plastic & Fiber Industries | Bake-Off Ovens

meta_description.description_text: Steelman Advanced Burn-off Ovens are used in the Plastics and Fiber Industries across the country. Used to clean molds, dies, screws, bowls, tooling, and safely remove thermoplastics, rubber, and polymers, our ovens can accommodate your needs. Steelman Advanced Burn-off Ovens can be equipped with Chart Recorders, Programmable Controllers, PLC or Computer Communication interfaces in order to measure and control precise temperature and time requirements determined by your specific product needs. Our burn-off ovens are equipped with patented top down heating system allowing for uniform temperature within the oven, lower particulate emissions, and control of the hottest part of the oven. Our burn-off ovens are also fitted with a patented system called the Automatic Process System which eliminates operator error using an Automatic Cycle Time System and a Three-Level Safety System.

title.title_text: Industrial Burn-Off Ovens for the Finishing Industry | Bake-Off Ovens

meta_description.description_text: Steelman offers very economical and efficient curing ovens for wet, E-coat, or dry powder coatings. Our ovens are designed specifically to provide the correct amount of heat for these treatments without burning the coating which can cause additional problems. The uniform heated convection air in your oven allows for superior temperature protection and curing of your parts. Steelman has customers who use finishing in their manufacturing processes in a variety of industries including hardware, electronics, aerospace, automotive, construction, and heavy equipment manufacturers. Finishing is used for a variety of reasons including the enhancement of electrical properties or to form and shape the treated material into the desired outcome. Steelman ovens are most often used for paint curing and enhancement of bonding adhesives.

meta_description.description_text: View All Products Our standard gas Walk-In or Truck-In ovens are available in a variety of custom and standard sizes. Our digital timers and UL listed control panel allows for higher usability and user control. Our gas ovens are built with durable iron frames and are heavily insulated to prevent temperature bleeding. Our ovens are fully assembled in our factory and are tested for both quality and functionality at maximum capabilities before shipping to customers. Our standard gas ovens can be used for a variety of industrial applications including: Paint Curing for water, solvent, or powder based paints. These ovens can also be used for the curing of other finishes including epoxy and varnishes. Preheating of molds, dies or other tools. Metal Finishing on machinery, tools, or other metal products. meta_description.description_text: View All ProductsOur Double Ended Electric Ovens are available in a variety of standard and custom sizes and feature double doors on either side of the ovens enclosure. Unlike our Gas Ovens, these ovens are powered entirely by electricity and are independent of any natural gas power. Many customers prefer Double Ended Ovens because the double doors provide easy access to the front and back of the oven. These direct fire, recirculating convection models are built with cast-iron burners and UL listed control panels. Our walk-in and truck-in models allow treated materials to be rolled in on transport carts or brought in on vehicles. title.title_text: Double-Ended Electric Ovens | Walk-In & Truck-In Ovens | Manufacturer

meta_description.description_text: View All ProductsOur Double Ended Electric Ovens are available in a variety of standard and custom sizes and feature double doors on either side of the ovens enclosure. Unlike our Gas Ovens, these ovens are powered entirely by electricity and are independent of any natural gas power. Many customers prefer Double Ended Ovens because the double doors provide easy access to the front and back of the oven. These direct fire, recirculating convection models are built with cast-iron burners and UL listed control panels. Our walk-in and truck-in models allow treated materials to be rolled in on transport carts or brought in on vehicles. Just like all our ovens, these models are assembled in our factory and tested for quality and functionality at maximum capacity to ensure customer satisfaction. Our Double Ended Electric Ovens can be used for a variety of industrial applications including: Paint Curing for water, solvent, or powder based paints. These ovens can also be used for the curing of other finishes including epoxy and varnishes. Preheating of molds, dies or other tools. Metal Finishing on machinery, tools, or other metal products. Repair of machinery, engines, or industrial equipment. Our ovens can be used for an unlimited number of applications which require operating temperatures up to 850 F.
